metadata.title: CVE-2019-11008 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20190322 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferoverflow in the function WriteXWDImage of coders/xwd.c, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.4~hg15968-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.4~hg15968-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.4~hg15968-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4~hg15968-1').
